item.title: A Warning Against Sufi Exaggeration and Misguidance
item.description:
Moosaa Richardson reminds us of the obligation of shunning ghuluww (going to extremes) in the Religion, in light of recent local visits of a severely deviant sufi, propped up as a "scholar" to spread misguidance and polytheism among unsuspecting Muslims. This khutbah refutes the false claim that the Prophet (may Allaah raise his rank and grant him peace) knew all matters of the past and future, everything in al-Lowh al-Mahfooth (the Preserved Tablet), as well as the keys of the Ghayb (unseen).
This Friday khutbah was recorded at al-Masjid al-Awwal in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania (USA) on 1438.03.17.

item.title: How Can There Be Good Religious Innovations in Islam?!
item.description:
In this Friday khutbah, Moosaa Richardson reminds us of the obligation to follow the Religion as it was revealed to be practiced and the necessity of shunning innovations, both big and small. He then mentions some false arguments propagated by Soofees and other deviants who wish to legitimize their newly-invented acts of worship.
A truly hard-hitting and evidence-based clarification! Powerful and clear evidences from the Book and the Sunnah, coupled with amazing statements and stances of the respected Companions, leave the silly mawlid activists exposed as the ignorant, conniving innovators they are.
It was recorded at al-Masjid al-Awwal in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania (USA) on 1438.03.10.

item.title: The Four Imams Warned Against Fanatical Taqleed (Blind Following)
item.description:
In this Friday sermon, Moosaa Richardson reminds us of the Quranic obligation of following the Messenger of Allaah (may Allaah raise his rank and grant him peace) and making him the judge in all disputes between us. Recorded at al-Masjid al-Awwal in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania (USA) on 1438.02.18.

item.title: Voting and Democracy: Should Muslims Get Involved?
item.description:
Moosaa Richardson warns us of the fraudulent replacements for Islam's scholars, those who say we need Western scholars and we can no longer "outsource" our fatwas overseas! The ambition of various entertainers, storytellers, and pretenders to knowledge is exposed, along with their ambition to take the place of the scholars in the lives of the Muslims.
A very timely example of their detrimental interference in Islamic rulings is provided: adopting Western politics and embracing their democratic systems, something encouraged as absolutely necessary by the fraudulent, but forbidden by the real scholars of Islam.
This Friday sermon was delivered at al-Masjid al-Awwal in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania (USA) on 1438.02.04.

item.title: Believers Distinguish Themselves & Do not Celebrate Halloween!
item.description:
Moosaa Richardson reminds us in this Friday khutbah to remember the great favor of Allaah upon us, that He has guided us to the only acceptable Religion in the Hereafter. As a result, we should embody the distinctions that Allaah has given the believers over the disbelievers in our speech and action. He then reminds us to be different from misguided people who wear masks and dress up as demons and witches on a day to honor the Shayaateen called "Halloween", and that Muslims have been forbidden from imitating the disbelievers.
Recorded at al-Masjid al-Awwal in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania (USA) on 1438.01.27.

item.title: Do We Really Know About Ikhlaas (Sincerity)?!
item.description:

But its in the books, not in our hearts, except for the few whom Allaah has blessed. This emotional reminder by Moosaa Richardson attempts to help us resolve our flawed situation.
This was the Friday khutbah at al-Masjid al-Awwal in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania (USA) on 1437.11.23.

item.title: Khutbah: Don't Be Deluded by Numbers
item.description:
Moosaa Richardson offers these post-Ramadhan points of reflection about thanking Allaah for the increase in our ranks while not getting tricked into catering to the large numbers and watering down the message. He draws on the Battle of Hunayn, when the Companions were impressed by their numbers and then tried as a result, as well as other important textual evidences that indicate the Truth being found with the minority, even in the ranks of the Muslims.
This Friday khutbah was recorded at al-Masjid al-Awwal in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania (USA) on 1437.10.03.
